alert.note: Alert for Cortland (New York) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Binghamton (South Central New York and Northeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued February 18 at 4:16AM EST until February 20 at 2:30AM EST by NWS Binghamton
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in New York... Tioughnioga River At Cortland affecting Cortland County. .Heavy rain will fall on a deep primed snowpack leading to the melt increasing. Flows in rivers will increase quickly and reach critical levels. For the Tioughnioga River Basin...including Cortland...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT FROM THIS AFTERNOON TO EARLY SUNDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Tioughnioga River At Cortland. * WHEN...From this afternoon to early Sunday morning. * IMPACTS...At 8.0 feet, Minor flood stage. Flooding leads to some closures along Kellogg Road to the south of Cortland. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 4:00 AM EST Friday the stage was 5.9 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage this afternoon to a crest of 8.6 feet just after midnight tonight. It will then fall below flood stage early Saturday afternoon. - Flood stage is 8.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov.
